Fields.DialogueText: New Orleans! Where are you? New Orleans!
*giggle*
New Orleans? Is that you?
*laughs*
New Orleans? NEW--
*ALARM*
Okay. So it's going to be one of those days.
@BATTLE
New Orleans?
New Orleans, report in! I need to be sure you're in good health. New Orleans?
There's "NO Boat" here by that name...

Fields.MenuText: New Orleans!
...NO Boat?
Marco--

Fields.DialogueText: "NO Boat" answers to New Orleans, Capt'n...
New Orleans!
Polo!
There you are. When you went quiet after the battle, you had me concerned.
Sorry to worry you, Capt'n. But trust me. It takes a lot more than that to bring me down.
New Orleans, I've been looking all over for you.
Beg your pardon? You must have me mistaken for someone else. I'm Lady Liberty.
You're... the Statue of Liberty?
That's right, Capt'n.
At sea. On my deck.
And a pleasure it is to be here. You run a fine ship of huddled masses, I must say.
Really, you aren't fooling anyone, New Orleans.
Are you accusing a lady of lying, Capt'n? What makes you so sure I'm not Lady Liberty?

Fields.MenuText: You're a little short to be the Statue of Liberty.
Maybe it's the turrets?
You aren't fooling anyone, New Orleans.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe keel to tower, but bow-to-stern I've got her beat. I mean...
Those are hips, Cap. And just between us, the girdle I wear when I'm on duty in the harbor? Just torture.
So in addition to being a liar, you're calling me a fool?. For shame, Cap.
Now that I think about it, I do remember seeing a lovely Belle just now... heading for the bridge.
And why would she be going there?
Probably to let her captain know she spotted a Morgana nearby. If you'll excuse me, I think I, Lady Liberty, will retire to my stateroom. Er, I mean... to my island.
*ALARM*
Make-believe time is over. I'll meet you on the bridge, New Orleans.
@BATTLE
New Orleans. To the bridge.
*A voice calls out: "Now, now, Capt'n. You know the proper phrase..."*
New Orleans...
*That voice again: "Say it."*
*Heavy sigh*
*Ahem* Olly, olly, oxen free...
You called, Capt'n?

Fields.MenuText: That's enough, New Orleans. It's undignified.
I can't believe I'm saying that.
I shouldn't have to.

Fields.DialogueText: Never let dignity stand in the way of fun, I always say.
I suppose I could be persuaded to choose something else... do you know I'm a Little Teapot?
Now, now, Capt'n. You're not above the rules.
I shouldn't have to go hunting for you every time I want to speak to you. Or say something that ridiculous when it's urgent...
If you feel that strongly about it, I'll be more than happy to be dressed down... privately... by you.
But that's going to have to wait until later.
Why is that?
You're not the only one I play hide and seek with, Capt'n. The Morganas decided to be it this time... and they're close...
@BATTLE
Capt'n, not to get "sees all, hears all" on you, but I know when you want to talk to me. When it's important, you can bet I'm already at your side.
And yet, you still make me say that childish line.
Of course!
If the line wasn't so undignified and silly, you'd weasel out of playing hide and seek. And then, you'd never come looking for me.
That's your gauge, Capt'n. If something's not worth losing a little dignity to talk to me about, you need to get out and find me.
And why should I need to do that?
The crew can read tension, Capt'n. If you're out looking for me they'll know it's not over some life-or-death situation.
That's not really your job, New Orleans.

Fields.MenuText: Enough hiding from me, okay?
I don't want to be the party-pooper here, but if you don't stop hiding on me I'll make it an order. Understand?
Don't hide from me again. That's an order.

Fields.DialogueText: I won't hide when you call me. Got it.
Understood. I won't hide from you any more.
Very well. Your order is absolute. I will not hide myself from you.
Playing hide and seek with Morganas is still acceptable, right?
Sure. I suppose that is one way to look at our job.
@BATTLE
Capt'n!
What is it, New Orleans? Another Morgana attack?
No, something worse!
What's more serious than the Morganas?
I've lost my silver half-dollar!
That's worse than a marauding pack of Morganas?
You bet it is! My coin could be anywhere!

Fields.MenuText: I could say something about taking care of your own things...
...Here, if it makes you feel better, I've got two quarters in my pocket...
We haven't been in port for a while. It should still be on the ship...

Fields.DialogueText: You can lecture me all you like after I find my half dollar!
No no, you don't understand!
But there are a million places it could be!
It's priceless! IRREPLACEABLE!
What makes it irreplaceable?
It was a souvenir from that International Exposition they had in San Diego.
...Yeah, that sounds pretty hard to replace. And it could be anywhere?
ANYWHERE!
You really have no idea?
None, Capt'n. I'd like to start with that Morgana mist over there, though...
@BATTLE
You may have to accept that your souvenir half dollar is gone.
I bet it's still on board. I caught sight of it for half a second while we were fighting.
That's good news. Do you have a sense of where it was?
Nope!
We were in combat, I had a few hundred more important things to track.
You have a point.
Hey, here's a thought: since that last fight, the crew has already been on the lookout for damage to the ship...
You want me to drag the crew into this?
I'm desperate here, Capt'n! DESPERATE!!

Fields.MenuText: Did you look in the last place you saw it?
I'm sure it will turn up sooner or later. Maybe.
And I'm the captain, Desperate. Pleased to meet you.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the first place I looked.
See? Even you can't be sure.
See? I knew you had it in you.
What if looking for it was optional? Then you wouldn't be abusing your position.
That sounds fair, I suppose.
You know what would really motivate people? A reward. Like... a day pass for the next time we're in port!
Why do I have to provide the reward for finding something you lost?
I could...
*winks*
If you really, really want me to reward someone my way...
That won't be necessary... I'll offer a day pass as a reward - but only one, understand?
Sure! So... if I find it, do I get the pass?
No! What would you even do with one anyway?
You're so harsh, Capt'n. Even a Belle can get stir crazy!
It's a little hard for me to provide incentives around here.
Captain, this sealed envelope turned up with directions to return it to you if found...
Looks like we have a scavenger hunt winner already. Great job!
Scavenger hunt? That's an interesting turn of...
New Orleans, didn't I say something about hiding?
You don't want me to hide from you, and here I am! My own things, on the other hand....
@BATTLE
Seriously though, Capt'n... I'd like some help here.
*Pssst!*
It's too early for this...
I waited to make contact as long as I could.
New Orle--
*SSShhhhhhh*! No names please. This place is crawling with spies!
Really.
Certainly. I saw one just now when I looked in the mirror.
A spy. I would think you'd be in a trenchcoat and fedora, then.
Yeah, I know. I'm still trying to haggle a coat out of Verdun, but she's a tough nut to crack. She thinks I'd use it to go out buck naked.
And would you?
Hee. Absolutely.
But enough of that. Captain, I happened to discover a most distressing secret.
Oh?
Steel yourself, Cap. The food... served to the crew... is TERRIBLE!
Oh, that. That's no secret.
WHAT?! How can you say that?!
It's true. We've had some difficulties lately with procurement, and... well, it is what it is.
But why?! Setting aside my pride... and taste buds... I feel that feeding the crew pathetic meals is criminal!

Fields.MenuText: It doesn't seem that bad to me...
Call it naval tradition.
There are nearly a thousand bodies on this boat, New Orleans. We can't cater to everyone.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course it isn't for YOU... You're the captain, Capt'n.
So if the captain goes down with the ship... want me to hold you to that?
I'm not asking for Pâté De Foie Gras, but I die a little inside with every serving of powdered eggs!
Point taken. But what do you want me to do about it?
Finish your breakfast, first. And quickly, I might add.
Huh? Why?
So that you can eat breakfast at all... I've spotted Morganas.
@BATTLE
New Orleans, would you mind explaining to me what has been going on between you and the buglemaster?
*furtive look to the right*
Off shift.
*furtive look to the left*
In the starboard engine room...
*grins*
That was an inspection, Capt'n! A very thorough one I might add.
Inspection?
Exactly, Capt'n! Do you have any idea how important lip strength is to embouchure? How can you play a bugle without proper lip form? It's a calamity to the ear!
As this ship's Belle and a musician myself, I feel it's my responsibility - no, my patriotic duty! - to inspect a sailor's performance.

Fields.MenuText: And did Everitt pass muster?
How many other sailors are you inspecting?
And will you be inspecting Buglemaster Everitt again?

Fields.DialogueText: *winks* Everitt passed muster... with relish and ketchup, too.
*winks* Oh, I keep an eye on everyone in the crew.
*winks* If I feel the need...
Forget I said anything.
And it looks like you'll see an immediate return on my professional investment in your crew, Capt'n! There's a Morgana pack nearby thinking we're unprepared.
@BATTLE
New Orleans...
You have the eyes of Homer, for I am no mere Belle of that stripe.
Ah, so it's more make-believe for New Orleans today. So you're, uh... Achilles?
Working on it. Still trying to get materials for a Grecian fountain disguise. Who better for one than a hero of mythical proportions?
It may not be ready yet, but once water flows from my barrels, epic poems will be sung about it.
From your barrels?
Either that, or I have to keep gulping water and spitting it out of my mouth.
Eh, I'll take your word for it. But a classy fountain, here on the docks? Even you've got to admit that's kind of out-of-place.
I am rather attached to my hull, here. Can't stray too far.
Is that why you didn't leave with those people I just saw here?
You saw that, huh?

Fields.MenuText: I did. What's the deal?
It wasn't hard. So what are you up to this time?
When people talk at a fountain and the fountain talks back, it draws attention. And they were talking to you because...?

Fields.DialogueText: The deal, Capt'n?
Depends on how high I feel like floating... seriously, though...
Talking fountains draw attention. Good to know. As for what was said...
I'm sorry, but I can't tell you that.
Loose lips sink ships!
*winks*
In more ways than one, I might add.
New Orleans...
Okay, okay. I have a friend here in port.
You seem to have a friend in every port, New Orleans.
That I do! Often more than one!
Anyway, that friend runs a restaurant around here. Which is where they're off to.
Who is "they"?
The galley chief and one of the engine room grease monkeys.
The chief I understand, but why the engineer?
I overheard him say he had baking experience stateside. And that he could probably bake better than the chief.
A bread bake-off. The restaurant is neutral territory and my friend can be an unbiased judge, right? So it comes down to talent.
They're AWOL, you know.
They would be, if you hadn't signed those passes...
I don't remember doing that.
Remember when I wanted to see what your signature looked like if you wrote it with either hand?
And I was hoping to be a judge, too... but with a Morgana heading this way, I guess I'll have to settle for fresh instead of piping hot. She's going to pay for that.
Hey Bosun! Whistle me aboard!
*wolf whistle*
@BATTLE
So, New Orleans. What were the results of the baking contest?
Oh, it was no contest...
The grease monkey won, hands down.
Really?
Yup. So here's where you come in, Capt'n...
Me?
Yes. Remember the terrible food?

Fields.MenuText: I think I can see where this is going...
Sounds like I need to make someone my personal chef... just kidding.
And I suppose the galley staff has a engineering wizard they aren't using?

Fields.DialogueText: I knew you would.
Nice to see you developing a sense of humor.
Don't be silly, there's a second turret gunner who is a much better fit... who is replaced by Seaman Zehner from Browning number 3... who is replaced by...
That doesn't solve the whole problem, you know.
Oh, I know. There's a bunch of factors you can't control, like weather or Morganas. It also doesn't fix being out to sea so long that we're down to canned spam three meals a day.
Good.
Still, it can't hurt to be fed by those who can make even S.O.S. something to look forward to, rather than clods that reduce filet mignon to charcoal!
You think the cook is that bad?
Not that bad. But he can't bake, that's for sure. Want to taste test for yourself?
You know... I think I'll be going.
@BATTLE
Okay, okay... I still think the folks in the shop could make it good as new, but if we need a new clarinet case, then we need a new clarinet case.
At least it preserved the clarinet.
Preserved it from what?
Morgana collateral damage, Capt'n. Remind me to add music critic to Malice's list of crimes later... oops.
Cut to the chase, New Orleans. What is all this about?
We're forming a jazz band, Capt'n!
Impressed? I've got players from the crew. I found out that our quartermaster is a demon on the saxophone.
I didn't know the quartermaster could play the sax.
She is, and really good, too! She grew up in Chicago and saw King Oliver's Creole Jazz Band play as a little girl. It makes me a little jealous!
Where did you manage to find instruments?
It wasn't easy, let me tell you. But I know people who know people...
New Orleans, these better not be hot.
Nope. Stealing another musician's source of music is unthinkable.
*grins* No, these came from pawn shops and music stores... the cheapest ones we could scrounge up.
Except for the coronet... McDermott won that for us in a poker game...
I'm no judge, but they still look too nice to be that cheap.
They didn't start out looking this nice, but there are guys in maintenance who know their stuff.
I know what we pay gunner's mates. Even a beat up trombone would set him back months... where'd Srinivas get the money for that?
The ship's slush fund...
The slush fund? As in, my discretionary budget?
Yes, Capt'n. And that was a mighty generous loan you gave! Pharmacist's Mate Witkowsky... he's played drums since he was in grade school.
I mean honestly, Capt'n, how can you have jazz without drums?

Fields.MenuText: I never really thought about it.
Good question... maybe your group could do some music other than jazz?
I don't know the first thing about jazz and I don't care.

Fields.DialogueText: Trust me, Capt'n, it's like rum raisin ice cream without the raisins! Or the rum!
That's heresy, Capt'n! There's plenty of room on board this ship for other types of music, but these people have the chops for jazz. I can't waste that talent!
That's okay. I won't hold it against you.
Hear them play at least once before you hand down judgement, Capt'n. You'll be amazed how good they sound together.
I... suppose I could give them a chance.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
New Orleans, what is that I smell?
Shrimp étouffée. Should have known the air ducts would give it away...
Care to explain this?
You know, Capt'n, if you're on the ropes and ready to throw in the towel, there's nothing like the sweet smell of good food to send you back in and swinging!
Makes sense.
And when it's as good as it smells? Now that's a knock out!
I hope so, since all this boxing talk won't save you if you fail to deliver.
Just been chatting with Salt Lake City. Tough in the ring, that one.

Fields.MenuText: Wish you'd been a boxing champ instead of... whatever it is that you do.
Your boxing banter needs work.
Do I need to ban your little games?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm still a great fighter.
*Oof* A jab to the ego! Back to the drawing board, then...
I'd advise against that, since you never know when some playfulness might come in handy.
Now, about the shrimp étouffée...
Whoops! It is first come, first served... and there's a mess of Morganas that think they're coming to dinner.
Somehow, I don't think the shrimp étouffée is why they're here.
@BATTLE
Hurry up and hand me those, Jerry. And that magazine, too.
Hurry, Anish! The pinup on the bulkhead! The Capt'n is coming!
We're out of time...
Who is out of time, New Orleans?
*grins*
That would be me, Capt'n. If you'll excuse me...
What's that you're carrying?
Carrying?
In that bag.
Bag?
The one behind your back.
My back, Capt'n?

Fields.MenuText: New Orleans, are you interfering with my inspection?
I'd really like a look at that bag, New Orleans.
New Orleans, I wasn't born yesterday. I have a pretty good idea what's in that bag.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course not, Capt'n. Don't mind me...inspect away!
This? There's nothing here worth looking at, Capt'n. Just some stuff the crew wanted me to dispose of.
Bag, Capt'n?
Why do I get the feeling you're helping them hide things from me? Things like girlie magazines and posters?
Oh, darn! We'll have to save this for another time. A Morgana off to port wants to inspect us, too!
If I didn't know better, I'd say Morganas were in on this, too.
Hmmm... now, there's an idea...
New Orleans!
*winks*
Calling the crew to battle stations right now, Capt'n!
@BATTLE
Beignets?
Surely you've heard of them? Like donuts, only better. With a little powdered sugar on top? They're like a piece of heaven.
A little... we have powdered sugar, New Orleans?
The officers' mess does... er... did...
Sounds like we have different opinions on what a little means. And is there enough for everyone?
Not exactly, Capt'n. Think of this time as a shakedown.. and the Morgana trying to sneak up on us doesn't get any. But if you'd like...
@BATTLE
I was wondering when you'd get back, New Orleans. Now, about that powdered sugar you stole...
Smells divine, right, Capt'n? I don't blame you for being speechless... These beauties will take your breath away!
That's not what had me at a loss for words, New Orleans.
Well, it wasn't easy to sneak back and forth, if you were wondering.
I'll have to talk with the galley chief, though... they need to handle traffic control in the galley a little better. I never realized the galley was such a popular place...

Fields.MenuText: I imagine it wouldn't be a problem if you didn't have to sneak around.
I don't imagine the galley was designed with theft in mind.
Maybe our cooks need to run a tighter galley.

Fields.DialogueText: But what fun would that be?
Not taking that sugar would have stolen the experience of these beignets from our taste buds!
True - ingredients like this aren't cheap! We wouldn't want anything to walk off the shelves.
So what do you think?
*sigh* I think I need more beignet to go with my powdered sugar...
Hee hee hee!
Battle stations!
You heard the Capt'n! Battle stations!
Full Speed Ahead!
It's obvious that you want a piece of that Morgana...
Faster... faster....!
We'll reach her.
I know we will... but a botched rendezvous and no escorts... they cut it too close.
And now we do what we can. We'll protect that resupply.
Yeah... Time to blow those Morgana garbage scows off course!
@BATTLE
You're in a better mood...
Why shouldn't I be? Mission accomplished.
We've accomplished missions before. But you seem extra pleased this time... humming and dancing...
Aw, Capt'n. You should know by now.
I do. You still look like the cat that ate the canary, though.
Well, the ship we protected had some precious cargo...
Oh? More precious than ammo, sugar, flour, and toilet paper?
Letters from home. They're worth their weight in gold.

Fields.MenuText: Not every letter from home is good news.
Home is what we're fighting for. Letters are a part of that.
You weren't expecting anything yourself, were you?

Fields.DialogueText: When it comes from home, sometimes bad news is better than none at all.
Couldn't agree more, Capt'n.
Just the Sears catalog...
Nice work, New Orleans.
Finished touring the decks, New Orleans? How do we look?
We look fine. You, however, look like you need something.
And what is that, exactly?
Hm... Lemme get a close look at that mug of yours, Capt'n...

Fields.MenuText: Is there something in my eye?
I'll admit - I'm enjoying the attention from you.
Do you have to stare at me like that? It makes me uncomfortable.

Fields.DialogueText: So much in those eyes, Capt'n... but I think I found the problem.
Mmmm... Maybe you're not the only one enjoying this, Capt'n... Now shush up and lemme look!
We should do this more, so you'd get used to it.
Hmm... just as I thought. You need a little bit of rest.
So I look a little tired? Hardly a mystery, New Orleans.
I'd say let's do something fun together and relax, but somebody else just showed up on your schedule.
@BATTLE
Can we just--
Ssh! I'm still looking.
Morganas...
Still practicing, Quartermaster?
When I'm off duty, Cap.
My saxophone won't play itself, and I still have room for improvement.

Fields.MenuText: New Orleans isn't pressuring you, is she?
You didn't play for a living before this, did you?
New Orleans still hasn't given up on a jazz band, has she?

Fields.DialogueText: No, she's not. Not much, at least. But I'd forgotten how much fun it can be to play... it really is a good way to pass the time.
No, but I'll take that as a compliment.
No, Captain. She has plans.
Grilling my sax player is playing dirty, Capt'n!
I didn't think a progress report was a problem.
But it'll spoil the surprise!
I don't like surprises. It's part of a captain's job description, I think.
I do. When I do the surprising, that is.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
What are you up to this time?
Capt'n?
I've never seen you this quiet, so you must be up to something. A simple blanket on deck...
All the better to hold a stargazing party. Or clouds, depending on the weather. I'm not particular.
You're the only one here. Humming to yourself...
It's a quiet sort of time on deck, isn't it? A lot of the crew have retired to their bunks.
What about you?
The way I see it, there's no rest for the wicked, right? Then so long as the Garbage Fleet doesn't rest, neither do I. I'll get up in a bit and keep the shift company...
...you on the other hand, should find your bunk.
Or do you need my help to find it?
*winks*
Why do you do that?
Do what, Capt'n?
You know what I mean, New Orleans. You're as serious... and dangerous.. as any Belle out there. But you play around every chance you get...
Exactly.
So there is method to your madness. I get that you like the crew in high spirits...
It goes beyond that, Capt'n. I don't know where the Morganas came from, but I'm here to send them back permanently. This is war, and war is hell.
If I could do this all by my lonesome and spare my crew that hell, I wouldn't think twice. But I can't.
So this is to ease your guilt?
Not at all. I'm proud of my crew. I couldn't ask for better. Trust me, Capt'n - together, we're going to send the Morganas packing. Their days are numbered.
So why all the irreverence?
Because it would break my heart if all these fine folks took away from this were nightmares. If a little tomfoolery here and there can create a few pleasant memories, well...
I see.
I have no problem being a laughingstock - a jester - if it provides something they can look back on and laugh about later.

Fields.MenuText: That is the most noble thing I've ever heard.
That kind of foresight makes you even less of a fool, you know.
If only you didn't make me the Groucho to your Harpo and Chico.

Fields.DialogueText: *grins* Aw, you're making me blush.
*grins* Then I hope you'll keep it under your hat, Capt'n.
But it fits so well, Cap!
Don't get me wrong though... I love a good party.
I can't see you avoiding a bad party, either.
True. Find your bunk, Cap. The next battle will come all too soon for you.
@BATTLE
New Orleans, who taught you how to signal with flags?
Hello there, Capt'n! And my semaphore training? Self taught.
You do have a certain style that's conspicuously different than the other signalmen.
Oh?
They don't dance around so much.
I wanted to add more excitement to the whole thing. After all, aren't signalmen also called "skivvie wavers"?
They are, but they don't wave their own underwear around.
Where's the fun in that?
You're at risk of sending the wrong message.
Oh, I think my message was loud and clear...

Fields.MenuText: I don't mind your style, New Orleans, but other ships might not appreciate it.
Look at my face. Get my message?
Turn in your flags, New Orleans.

Fields.DialogueText: Understood. Some Belles out there who have absolutely no sense of humor, and I'd rather not have to dodge friendly fire.
Hmmm... it's either saying "I'm annoyed" or... "Kiss me." Gosh, talk about mixed messages, Capt'n!
But Capt'n, if I did that, I'd have no skivvies!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Ah, mon Capitaine! Vous avez l'air bien aujourd'hui!
Hello to you, too, New Orleans. I shouldn't be surprised to hear you speaking French.
Oui! I enjoy showing off all aspects of my namesake, ... mon Capitaine.
That's not all you like to show off, New Orleans.

Fields.MenuText: You really thrive on attention, don't you?
I've noticed... and I've been appreciating them for awhile.
(rolls eyes)

Fields.DialogueText: Come on, Capt'n. You know there's more to it.
Good luck trying to make me blush!
Ha! Now, now, Capt'n. I'm sure a clever one like you understands.
I do understand, New Orleans. All of your theatrics and big personality...
What about 'em, Capt'n?
It all entertains the crew. What you do for them, and their morale...
*grins*
Sounds like you really do appreciate my assets, Capt'n!
@BATTLE
Ah! Mon Capitaine, I was wondering when you'd finally notice my lovely aspects...
*ALARM*
A camera?
Yes, Capt'n. They capture images onto film so that you can...
I know what a camera is, New Orleans.

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure you have a good reason to want one, but they're not that easy to come by out here.
And the slush fund is off limits.
Is there anything you aren't interested in?

Fields.DialogueText: I have a friend who can rustle one up. And I can pay for it, Capt'n.
Not to worry, Capt'n! I plan to pay for it myself.
Give me a minute... I'll think of something...
And where did you get the money?
Ah... no time to answer! We have to deal with the Morganas slinking around to the west of us.
@BATTLE
Okay, New Orleans. I'll bite. What do you plan to do with a camera?
They say a picture is worth a thousand words, right?
Yes...
Well, some of the crew aren't as good with words as others. And even a good letter is better with a picture.
The crew may be totally dedicated to the fight, but they still miss home and want to share a bit with their loved ones.
I see your point. I suppose it wouldn't hurt, provided the pictures avoid any sensitive information - our location and weapons, you understand.
Count on me, Capt'n.
You seem like you know what you're doing, New Orleans. And this space does make a decent darkroom.
Not the first time it's been a darkroom, Capt'n. There's never been a need for one permanently, but I am a top-of-the-line US cruiser, you know. The need arises occasionally.
And the developing supplies and equipment?
Oh, just a little more of my spending money. You know that little show I put on at the dock last port?

Fields.MenuText: Yes. That little incident did get back to me.
Don't remind me. The portmaster was fit to be tied.
I'm sure I'll look back on that and laugh... eventually. For now, do you think you could you give me warning before your next little show?

Fields.DialogueText: They'll have forgotten about by the time we go back there. ... Maybe.
I could have helped with that...
Sorry, Capt'n, but it was all I could throw together on short notice like that. Next time will be much bigger and better planned.
So what do we have here?
This is my favorite part. I feel like a kid in a candy shop!
Oh?
Capt'n, I can't go into town like you and the crew. I know all about The Big Easy and Brooklyn, but I can't wander and experience it myself.
I see.
So the buglemaster had the idea for the crew to take the camera out on shore leave and take pictures. Then they hand the film to me and I develop it.
That's... a pretty good idea, actually.
Afterwards, I can talk with the people in the pictures and the ones taking pictures. They'll tell me the most splendid stories, I'm sure.
Oh! Look at this one...
Looks like Gunner's Mate Srinivas had a really good time!
New Orleans, I think I've seen enough...
A good thing, too. I sense Morganas with bad timing closing in. Would you be a dear and close up before opening the door?
I'll have the crew at battle stations by the time you get to the bridge! Thanks!
@BATTLE
Hey, wait, I'm not going to--
So this was the reason for the bourbon?
Yup, Capt'n! You can't make milk punch without bourbon. Not even whiskey will do. And not just any bourbon will do either!
But isn't bourbon whisky?
For shame, Capt'n. There's just no comparison. And even with bourbon, you have to get it from the right place. Bourbon County, Kentucky!
I'm surprised you're so passionate about someplace other than the Big Easy.
Oh, the Crescent City still wins in this, Capt'n. Kentucky makes bourbon. We Creole, then elevate it to perfection.
Well, I can see why this had to be done in port, alcohol aside. Fresh cream.
Not just that. Real nutmeg and vanilla. I had to work hard to get these.
And there's another delightful spirit...
*grins*
I'll teach you to flirt yet, Capt'n! There's no substitute for Caribbean rum, Capt'n. Finest nectar on the planet comes from New Orleans.
I think I may have corrupted you, Capt'n. You're blushing!

Fields.MenuText: You're imagining things.
I'm not blushing, New Orleans. I think you have enough booze sloshing around in here to make anyone a little light headed.
I don't think I ever stood a chance, New Orleans.

Fields.DialogueText: I haven't had nearly enough to drink yet to imagine that.
Oh, just wait until you actually drink it!
Of course not, Capt'n. I'm as persistent as the Mother River herself.
So, is it ready?
You'll want to drink it chilled, Capt'n. This isn't a drink you want to let sit.
It's... strong. Such a rich taste, too.
*grins*
Like me, Capt'n?
@BATTLE
New Orleans, do you enjoy living dangerously?
Are you trying to create an international incident?
Hee hee.
So, who's this?
This kitten here? I don't know... she just came along and started playing with a reed from my disguise. She certainly is friendly.
Before you ask...
Not to worry, Capt'n, she won't be coming with me.

Fields.MenuText: You're pulling my leg.
That's surprising. I thought you'd love a pet.
Really? Wouldn't having a cat around raise the crew's spirits?

Fields.DialogueText: If you insist... but, no. Really. I can resist the urge to take her with me.
I would! But she'd be another mouth to feed, right?
A cutie like this sure would. Still...
A pet is a big responsibility.
Yet you do manage to find the most irresponsible ways to be entertaining...
I generally understand what you want to accomplish, so couldn't you ask me about your ideas first? I'm not an ogre. I do know how to say yes.
But you also know how to say no...
After all, my nickname is NO Boat, remember?
Yes.
Where my crew and I are concerned, sometimes "no" is the one thing I don't want to take for an answer, even from you.
So I force the fait accompli and take my lumps afterwards.
Better to beg forgiveness than ask permission.
*grins*
That's the way I see it. It's worked so far, too. So what brings you out? You didn't come all this way to see me?
As a matter of fact, I did. Orders came down for us.
No rest for the wicked. Hey, Bosun! Whistle me aboard!
*Wolf whistle*
@BATTLE
That is a serious accusation.
*meow!*
HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!
New Orleans...
Now, now, don't be shy! Everyone chipped in for the cost of cake ingredients, so we made a big one!
That certainly is big... it looks big enough to feed the whole boat.
Sure does! And we have music too - The Big Easy Revue!
I don't remember there being a banjo player last time...
The piano was too bulky. Expensive! I mean expensive!
You... do know it's not my birthday, don't you?
It isn't?!
*performs a proper swoon*
Whatever shall we do?! We can't possibly waste this much cake--
It is my unbirthday, though.
It... it is? Ha ha ha!
Sure. I even brought a gift, too. Quartermaster?
That's...
*Meow!*
I just happened to find this stray on the dock. I handed her to Quartermaster Wills. I'm told our stores are pest free, and this arrangement should make sure they stay that way.
While I appreciate that, Captain, I have shifts to do and a band to practice in. I'm going to need some assistance with that.
I see. I'm sure our ship's Belle could be counted on to lend you a hand. Right, New Orleans?
*grins*
Right, Capt'n! You can count on me!
I'll just get our kitten set up with somewhere to sleep while we finish our party. I'll catch up with you in a bit, Capt'n!

Fields.MenuText: ... I hope she catches up with me soon.
I better find some place to hide before she decides she needs a piano after all.

Fields.DialogueText: Surprise! *grins*
